     5	First we define:

     7	Sq      as Q sequence length

     9	
    10	MLA has two possible ways of computing, a data-movement friendly approach and a
    11	compute friendly approach, we generally want to use the compute friendly
    12	approach for "prefill" (i.e. the ratio Sq / Skv is "small", is near 1)
    13	and the data-movement friendly approach for "decode" (i.e. the ratio
    14	Sq / Skv is "large").
    15	
    16	NOTE what we deem small and large is currently determined by if its labelled
    17	prefill or decode by the scheduler, but this is something we should probably
    18	tune.
    19	
    20	Main reference: DeepseekV2 paper, and FlashInfer Implementation
    21	(https://arxiv.org/abs/2405.04434 and https://github.com/flashinfer-ai/flashinfer/pull/551).
    22	
    23	Deepseek's MLA attention works the following way:
    24	* Use a single latent vector to represent the per-token entry of the KV cache.
    25	* For decode (i.e. the memory friendly approach) the attention "simulates" a
    26	multi-head attention, while the compute is similar to multi-query attention.
    27	
    28	Below is example of both paths assuming batchsize = 1
    29	
    30	## More Extent Definitions:
    31	
    32	C           Context length, `Skv - Sq`
    33	H           hidden size
    34	N           number of attention heads
    35	Lq          latent dimension for Q              1536 in DSV3
    36	Lkv         latent dimension for K/V            512 in DSV3
    37	P           nope dimension, no rope.            128 in DSV3
    38	R           rope dimension, goes through rope.  64 in DSV3
    39	V           V head dim.                         128 in DSV3
    40	
    41	## Vector/Matrix Definitions
    42	
    43	h_t         hidden states (input to attention)  shape [Sq, H]
    44	q_c         latent/compressed Q                 shape [Sq, Lq]
    45	q_nope      uncompressed Q (no-rope)            shape [Sq, N, P]
    46	q_pe        uncompressed Q (rope)               shape [Sq, N, R]
    47	kv_c        latent/compressed KV                shape [Skv, Lkv]
    48	k_pe        decoupled k position embeddings     shape [Skv, R]
    49	new_kv_c    new kv_c from current iter          shape [Sq, Lkv]
    50	new_k_pe    new k_pe from current iter          shape [Sq, R]
    51	cache_kv_c  cached k_c from previous iters      shape [C, Lkv]
    52	cache_k_pe  cached k_pe from previous iters     shape [C, R]
    53	W_DQ        project h_t to q_c                  shape [H, Lq]
    54	W_UQ        project q_c to q_nope               shape [Lq, N * P]
    55	W_QR        project q_c to q_pe                 shape [Lq, N * R]
    56	W_DKV       project h_t to kv_c                 shape [H, Lkv]
    57	W_UK        project kv_c to k_nope              shape [Lkv, N * P]
    58	W_KR        project h_t to k_pe                 shape [H, N * R]
    59	W_UV        project kv_c to v                   shape [Lkv, N * V]
    60	W_O         project v to h_t                    shape [N * V, H]
    61	
    62	
    63	## Compute Friendly Approach (i.e. "_forward_prefill"):
    64	
    65	q_c      = h_t @ W_DQ
    66	q_nope   = (q_c @ W_UQ).view(Sq, N, P)
    67	q_pe     = RoPE(q_c @ W_QR).view(Sq, N, R)
    68	new_kv_c = h_t @ W_DKV
    69	new_k_pe = RoPE(h_t @ W_KR)

    73	v        = (kv_c @ W_UV).view(Skv, N, V)

    76	//           V headdim = V
    77	//      spda_o shape [Sq, N, V]
    78	spda_o = scaled_dot_product_attention(

    80	    torch.cat([k_nope, k_pe.unsqueeze(1).expand(-1, N, -1)], dim=-1),
    81	    v
    82	)
    83	return spda_o @ W_O

    87	    `q_b_proj` is [W_UQ; W_QR] concatnated per head

    98	                ).view(Lkv, N * Lkv)

   103

   106	q_latent = q_c @ W_UQ_UK.view(Sq, N, Lkv)

   127	
   128	For chunked prefill we want to use the compute friendly algorithm. We are
   129	assuming sufficiently large Sq / Skv ratio, in the future may want to switch to

1	# SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0
     2	"""
     3	This file implements common components for MLA implementations.
     4	
     5	First we define:
     6	
     7	Sq      as Q sequence length
     8	Skv     as KV sequence length
     9	
    10	MLA has two possible ways of computing, a data-movement friendly approach and a
    11	compute friendly approach, we generally want to use the compute friendly
    12	approach for "prefill" (i.e. the ratio Sq / Skv is "small", is near 1)
    13	and the data-movement friendly approach for "decode" (i.e. the ratio
    14	Sq / Skv is "large").
    15	
    16	NOTE what we deem small and large is currently determined by if its labelled
    17	prefill or decode by the scheduler, but this is something we should probably
    18	tune.
    19	
    20	Main reference: DeepseekV2 paper, and FlashInfer Implementation
    21	(https://arxiv.org/abs/2405.04434 and https://github.com/flashinfer-ai/flashinfer/pull/551).
    22	
    23	Deepseek's MLA attention works the following way:
    24	* Use a single latent vector to represent the per-token entry of the KV cache.
    25	* For decode (i.e. the memory friendly approach) the attention "simulates" a
    26	multi-head attention, while the compute is similar to multi-query attention.
    27	
    28	Below is example of both paths assuming batchsize = 1
    29	
    30	## More Extent Definitions:
    31	
    32	C           Context length, `Skv - Sq`
    33	H           hidden size
    34	N           number of attention heads
    35	Lq          latent dimension for Q              1536 in DSV3
    36	Lkv         latent dimension for K/V            512 in DSV3
    37	P           nope dimension, no rope.            128 in DSV3
    38	R           rope dimension, goes through rope.  64 in DSV3
    39	V           V head dim.                         128 in DSV3
    40	
    41	## Vector/Matrix Definitions
    42	
    43	h_t         hidden states (input to attention)  shape [Sq, H]
    44	q_c         latent/compressed Q                 shape [Sq, Lq]
    45	q_nope      uncompressed Q (no-rope)            shape [Sq, N, P]
    46	q_pe        uncompressed Q (rope)               shape [Sq, N, R]
    47	kv_c        latent/compressed KV                shape [Skv, Lkv]
    48	k_pe        decoupled k position embeddings     shape [Skv, R]
    49	new_kv_c    new kv_c from current iter          shape [Sq, Lkv]
    50	new_k_pe    new k_pe from current iter          shape [Sq, R]
    51	cache_kv_c  cached k_c from previous iters      shape [C, Lkv]
    52	cache_k_pe  cached k_pe from previous iters     shape [C, R]
    53	W_DQ        project h_t to q_c                  shape [H, Lq]
    54	W_UQ        project q_c to q_nope               shape [Lq, N * P]
    55	W_QR        project q_c to q_pe                 shape [Lq, N * R]
    56	W_DKV       project h_t to kv_c                 shape [H, Lkv]
    57	W_UK        project kv_c to k_nope              shape [Lkv, N * P]
    58	W_KR        project h_t to k_pe                 shape [H, N * R]
    59	W_UV        project kv_c to v                   shape [Lkv, N * V]
    60	W_O         project v to h_t                    shape [N * V, H]
    61	
    62	
    63	## Compute Friendly Approach (i.e. "_forward_prefill"):
    64	
    65	q_c      = h_t @ W_DQ
    66	q_nope   = (q_c @ W_UQ).view(Sq, N, P)
    67	q_pe     = RoPE(q_c @ W_QR).view(Sq, N, R)
    68	new_kv_c = h_t @ W_DKV
    69	new_k_pe = RoPE(h_t @ W_KR)
    70	kv_c     = torch.cat([new_kv_c, cache_kv_c], dim=0)
    71	k_pe     = torch.cat([new_k_pe, cache_k_pe], dim=0)
    72	k_nope   = (kv_c @ W_UK).view(Skv, N, P)
    73	v        = (kv_c @ W_UV).view(Skv, N, V)
    74	
    75	// MHA with QK headdim = P + R
    76	//           V headdim = V
    77	//      spda_o shape [Sq, N, V]
    78	spda_o = scaled_dot_product_attention(
    79	    torch.cat([q_nope, q_pe], dim=-1),
    80	    torch.cat([k_nope, k_pe.unsqueeze(1).expand(-1, N, -1)], dim=-1),
    81	    v
    82	)
    83	return spda_o @ W_O
    84	
    85	NOTE: in the actual code,
    86	    `kv_b_proj` is [W_UK; W_UV] concatnated per head
    87	    `q_b_proj` is [W_UQ; W_QR] concatnated per head
    88	    `out_proj` is W_O
    89	
    90	
    91	## Data-Movement Friendly Approach (i.e. "_forward_decode"):
    92	
    93	Ahead of time, compute:
    94	
    95	% this projects from q_c to [Sq, N * Lkv]
    96	W_UQ_UK = einsum("qnp,knp -> qnk"
    97	                     W_UQ.view(Lq, N, P), W_UK.view(Lkv, N, P)
    98	                ).view(Lkv, N * Lkv)
    99	% this projects from attn output [Sq, N * Lkv] to [Sq, H]
   100	W_UV_O  = einsum("knv,nvh -> nkh"
   101	                     W_UV.view(Lkv, N, V), W_O.view(N, V, H)
   102	                ).view(N * Lkv, H)
   103	
   104	Runtime
   105	q_c      = h_t @ W_DQ
   106	q_latent = q_c @ W_UQ_UK.view(Sq, N, Lkv)
   107	q_pe     = RoPE(q_c @ W_QR).view(Sq, N, R)
   108	new_kv_c = h_t @ W_DKV
   109	new_k_pe = RoPE(h_t @ W_KR)
   110	kv_c     = torch.cat([new_kv_c, cache_kv_c], dim=0)
   111	k_pe     = torch.cat([new_k_pe, cache_k_pe], dim=0)
   112	
   113	// MQA with QK headdim = Lkv + R
   114	//           V headdim = Lkv
   115	//      spda_o shape [Sq, N, Lkv]
   116	// NOTE: this is less compute-friendly since Lkv > P
   117	//       but is more data-movement friendly since its MQA vs MHA
   118	spda_o = scaled_dot_product_attention(
   119	    torch.cat([q_latent, q_pe], dim=-1),
   120	    torch.cat([kv_c, k_pe], dim=-1),
   121	    kv_c
   122	)
   123	return spda_o.reshape(-1, N * Lkv) @ W_UV_O
   124	
   125	
   126	## Chunked Prefill
   127	
   128	For chunked prefill we want to use the compute friendly algorithm. We are
   129	assuming sufficiently large Sq / Skv ratio, in the future may want to switch to
   130	the data-movement friendly approach if the chunk (i.e. `Sq`) is small.
   131	
   132	However, the compute-friendly approach can potentially run out of memory if Skv
   133	is large due to: `k_nope = (kv_c @ W_UK).view(Skv, N, P)`
   134	
   135	To mitigate this, we chunk the computation of attention with respect to the
   136	current context (i.e. `cache_kv_c` and `cache_k_pe`) so that we can used a
   137	fixed workspace size.
   138	
   139	The chunked prefill approach is as follows:
   140	
   141	MCC        Max chunk of context to process per iter, computed dynamically,
   142	           used to bound the memory usage
   143	
   144	q_c        = h_t @ W_DQ
   145	q_nope     = (q_c @ W_UQ).view(Sq, N, P)
   146	q_pe       = RoPE(q_c @ W_QR).view(Sq, N, R)
   147	new_kv_c   = h_t @ W_DKV
   148	new_k_pe   = RoPE(h_t @ W_KR)
   149	new_k_nope = (new_kv_c @ W_UK).view(Sq, N, P)
   150	new_v      = (new_kv_c @ W_UV).view(Sq, N, V)
   151	
   152	// MHA between queries and new KV
   153	//     with QK headdim = P + R
   154	//           V headdim = V
   155	//    curr_o   shape [Sq, N, V]
   156	//    curr_lse shape [N, Sq], this is just order FA returns
   157	curr_o, curr_lse = scaled_dot_product_attention(
   158	    torch.cat([q_nope, q_pe], dim=-1),
   159	    torch.cat([new_k_nope, new_k_pe.unsqueeze(1).expand(-1, N, -1)], dim=-1),
   160	    new_v,
   161	    casual=True,
   162	    return_softmax_lse=True
   163	)
   164	
   165	// Compute attention with the already existing context
   166	for chunk_idx in range(cdiv(C, MCC)):
   167	    chunk_start  = chunk_idx * MCC
   168	    chunk_end    = min(chunk_start + MCC, C)
   169	    Sc           = chunk_end - chunk_start
   170	    cache_kv_c_chunk   = cache_kv_c[chunk_start:chunk_end]
   171	    cache_k_pe_chunk   = cache_k_pe[chunk_start:chunk_end]
   172	    cache_k_nope_chunk = (cache_kv_c_chunk @ W_UK).view(-1, N, P)
   173	    cache_v_chunk      = (cache_kv_c_chunk @ W_UV).view(-1, N, V)
   174	
   175	    chunk_o, chunk_lse = scaled_dot_product_attention(
   176	        torch.cat([q_nope, q_pe], dim=-1),
   177	        torch.cat([cache_k_nope_chunk,
   178	                   cache_k_pe_chunk.unsqueeze(1).expand(-1, N, -1)],
   179	                   dim=-1),
   180	        cache_v_chunk,
   181	        casual=False,
   182	        return_softmax_lse=True
   183	    )
   184	
   185	    curr_o, curr_lse = merge_attn_states(
   186	        suffix_output=curr_o,
   187	        suffix_lse=curr_lse,
   188	        prefix_output=chunk_o,
   189	        prefix_lse=chunk_lse,
   190	    )
   191	
   192	return curr_o @ W_O
   193	"""

     2	"""
     3	This file implements common components for MLA implementations.
     4	
     5	First we define:
     6	
     7	Sq      as Q sequence length
     8	Skv     as KV sequence length
     9	
    10	MLA has two possible ways of computing, a data-movement friendly approach and a
    11	compute friendly approach, we generally want to use the compute friendly
    12	approach for "prefill" (i.e. the ratio Sq / Skv is "small", is near 1)
    13	and the data-movement friendly approach for "decode" (i.e. the ratio
    14	Sq / Skv is "large").
    15	
    16	NOTE what we deem small and large is currently determined by if its labelled
    17	prefill or decode by the scheduler, but this is something we should probably
    18	tune.
    19	
    20	Main reference: DeepseekV2 paper, and FlashInfer Implementation
    21	(https://arxiv.org/abs/2405.04434 and https://github.com/flashinfer-ai/flashinfer/pull/551).
    22	
    23	Deepseek's MLA attention works the following way:
    24	* Use a single latent vector to represent the per-token entry of the KV cache.
    25	* For decode (i.e. the memory friendly approach) the attention "simulates" a
    26	multi-head attention, while the compute is similar to multi-query attention.
    27	
    28	Below is example of both paths assuming batchsize = 1
    29	
    30	## More Extent Definitions:
    31	
    32	C           Context length, `Skv - Sq`
    33	H           hidden size
    34	N           number of attention heads
    35	Lq          latent dimension for Q              1536 in DSV3
    36	Lkv         latent dimension for K/V            512 in DSV3
    37	P           nope dimension, no rope.            128 in DSV3
    38	R           rope dimension, goes through rope.  64 in DSV3
    39	V           V head dim.                         128 in DSV3
    40	
    41	## Vector/Matrix Definitions
    42	
    43	h_t         hidden states (input to attention)  shape [Sq, H]
    44	q_c         latent/compressed Q                 shape [Sq, Lq]
    45	q_nope      uncompressed Q (no-rope)            shape [Sq, N, P]
    46	q_pe        uncompressed Q (rope)               shape [Sq, N, R]
    47	kv_c        latent/compressed KV                shape [Skv, Lkv]
    48	k_pe        decoupled k position embeddings     shape [Skv, R]
    49	new_kv_c    new kv_c from current iter          shape [Sq, Lkv]
    50	new_k_pe    new k_pe from current iter          shape [Sq, R]
    51	cache_kv_c  cached k_c from previous iters      shape [C, Lkv]
    52	cache_k_pe  cached k_pe from previous iters     shape [C, R]
    53	W_DQ        project h_t to q_c                  shape [H, Lq]
    54	W_UQ        project q_c to q_nope               shape [Lq, N * P]
    55	W_QR        project q_c to q_pe                 shape [Lq, N * R]
    56	W_DKV       project h_t to kv_c                 shape [H, Lkv]
    57	W_UK        project kv_c to k_nope              shape [Lkv, N * P]
    58	W_KR        project h_t to k_pe                 shape [H, N * R]
    59	W_UV        project kv_c to v                   shape [Lkv, N * V]
    60	W_O         project v to h_t                    shape [N * V, H]
    61	
    62	
    63	## Compute Friendly Approach (i.e. "_forward_prefill"):
    64	
    65	q_c      = h_t @ W_DQ
    66	q_nope   = (q_c @ W_UQ).view(Sq, N, P)
    67	q_pe     = RoPE(q_c @ W_QR).view(Sq, N, R)
    68	new_kv_c = h_t @ W_DKV
    69	new_k_pe = RoPE(h_t @ W_KR)
    70	kv_c     = torch.cat([new_kv_c, cache_kv_c], dim=0)
    71	k_pe     = torch.cat([new_k_pe, cache_k_pe], dim=0)
    72	k_nope   = (kv_c @ W_UK).view(Skv, N, P)
    73	v        = (kv_c @ W_UV).view(Skv, N, V)
    74	
    75	// MHA with QK headdim = P + R
    76	//           V headdim = V
    77	//      spda_o shape [Sq, N, V]
    78	spda_o = scaled_dot_product_attention(
    79	    torch.cat([q_nope, q_pe], dim=-1),
    80	    torch.cat([k_nope, k_pe.unsqueeze(1).expand(-1, N, -1)], dim=-1),
    81	    v
    82	)
    83	return spda_o @ W_O
    84	
    85	NOTE: in the actual code,
    86	    `kv_b_proj` is [W_UK; W_UV] concatnated per head
    87	    `q_b_proj` is [W_UQ; W_QR] concatnated per head
    88	    `out_proj` is W_O
    89	
    90	
    91	## Data-Movement Friendly Approach (i.e. "_forward_decode"):
    92	
    93	Ahead of time, compute:
    94	
    95	% this projects from q_c to [Sq, N * Lkv]
    96	W_UQ_UK = einsum("qnp,knp -> qnk"
    97	                     W_UQ.view(Lq, N, P), W_UK.view(Lkv, N, P)
    98	                ).view(Lkv, N * Lkv)
    99	% this projects from attn output [Sq, N * Lkv] to [Sq, H]
   100	W_UV_O  = einsum("knv,nvh -> nkh"
   101	                     W_UV.view(Lkv, N, V), W_O.view(N, V, H)
   102	                ).view(N * Lkv, H)
   103	
   104	Runtime
   105	q_c      = h_t @ W_DQ
   106	q_latent = q_c @ W_UQ_UK.view(Sq, N, Lkv)
   107	q_pe     = RoPE(q_c @ W_QR).view(Sq, N, R)
   108	new_kv_c = h_t @ W_DKV
   109	new_k_pe = RoPE(h_t @ W_KR)
   110	kv_c     = torch.cat([new_kv_c, cache_kv_c], dim=0)
   111	k_pe     = torch.cat([new_k_pe, cache_k_pe], dim=0)
   112	
   113	// MQA with QK headdim = Lkv + R
   114	//           V headdim = Lkv
   115	//      spda_o shape [Sq, N, Lkv]
   116	// NOTE: this is less compute-friendly since Lkv > P
   117	//       but is more data-movement friendly since its MQA vs MHA
   118	spda_o = scaled_dot_product_attention(
   119	    torch.cat([q_latent, q_pe], dim=-1),
   120	    torch.cat([kv_c, k_pe], dim=-1),
   121	    kv_c
   122	)
   123	return spda_o.reshape(-1, N * Lkv) @ W_UV_O
   124	
   125	
   126	## Chunked Prefill
   127	
   128	For chunked prefill we want to use the compute friendly algorithm. We are
   129	assuming sufficiently large Sq / Skv ratio, in the future may want to switch to
   130	the data-movement friendly approach if the chunk (i.e. `Sq`) is small.
   131	
   132	However, the compute-friendly approach can potentially run out of memory if Skv
   133	is large due to: `k_nope = (kv_c @ W_UK).view(Skv, N, P)`
   134	
   135	To mitigate this, we chunk the computation of attention with respect to the
   136	current context (i.e. `cache_kv_c` and `cache_k_pe`) so that we can used a
   137	fixed workspace size.
   138	
   139	The chunked prefill approach is as follows:
   140	
   141	MCC        Max chunk of context to process per iter, computed dynamically,
   142	           used to bound the memory usage
   143	
   144	q_c        = h_t @ W_DQ
   145	q_nope     = (q_c @ W_UQ).view(Sq, N, P)
   146	q_pe       = RoPE(q_c @ W_QR).view(Sq, N, R)
   147	new_kv_c   = h_t @ W_DKV
   148	new_k_pe   = RoPE(h_t @ W_KR)
   149	new_k_nope = (new_kv_c @ W_UK).view(Sq, N, P)
   150	new_v      = (new_kv_c @ W_UV).view(Sq, N, V)
   151	
   152	// MHA between queries and new KV
   153	//     with QK headdim = P + R
   154	//           V headdim = V
   155	//    curr_o   shape [Sq, N, V]
   156	//    curr_lse shape [N, Sq], this is just order FA returns
   157	curr_o, curr_lse = scaled_dot_product_attention(
   158	    torch.cat([q_nope, q_pe], dim=-1),
   159	    torch.cat([new_k_nope, new_k_pe.unsqueeze(1).expand(-1, N, -1)], dim=-1),
   160	    new_v,
   161	    casual=True,
   162	    return_softmax_lse=True
   163	)
   164	
   165	// Compute attention with the already existing context
   166	for chunk_idx in range(cdiv(C, MCC)):
   167	    chunk_start  = chunk_idx * MCC
   168	    chunk_end    = min(chunk_start + MCC, C)
   169	    Sc           = chunk_end - chunk_start
   170	    cache_kv_c_chunk   = cache_kv_c[chunk_start:chunk_end]
   171	    cache_k_pe_chunk   = cache_k_pe[chunk_start:chunk_end]
   172	    cache_k_nope_chunk = (cache_kv_c_chunk @ W_UK).view(-1, N, P)
   173	    cache_v_chunk      = (cache_kv_c_chunk @ W_UV).view(-1, N, V)
   174	
   175	    chunk_o, chunk_lse = scaled_dot_product_attention(
   176	        torch.cat([q_nope, q_pe], dim=-1),
   177	        torch.cat([cache_k_nope_chunk,
   178	                   cache_k_pe_chunk.unsqueeze(1).expand(-1, N, -1)],
   179	                   dim=-1),
   180	        cache_v_chunk,
   181	        casual=False,
   182	        return_softmax_lse=True
   183	    )
   184	
   185	    curr_o, curr_lse = merge_attn_states(
   186	        suffix_output=curr_o,
   187	        suffix_lse=curr_lse,
   188	        prefix_output=chunk_o,
   189	        prefix_lse=chunk_lse,
   190	    )
   191	
   192	return curr_o @ W_O

    63	## Compute Friendly Approach (i.e. "_forward_prefill"):
    64	
    65	q_c      = h_t @ W_DQ
    66	q_nope   = (q_c @ W_UQ).view(Sq, N, P)
    67	q_pe     = RoPE(q_c @ W_QR).view(Sq, N, R)
    68	new_kv_c = h_t @ W_DKV
    69	new_k_pe = RoPE(h_t @ W_KR)
    70	kv_c     = torch.cat([new_kv_c, cache_kv_c], dim=0)
    71	k_pe     = torch.cat([new_k_pe, cache_k_pe], dim=0)
    72	k_nope   = (kv_c @ W_UK).view(Skv, N, P)
    73	v        = (kv_c @ W_UV).view(Skv, N, V)
    74	
    75	// MHA with QK headdim = P + R
    76	//           V headdim = V
    77	//      spda_o shape [Sq, N, V]
    78	spda_o = scaled_dot_product_attention(
    79	    torch.cat([q_nope, q_pe], dim=-1),
    80	    torch.cat([k_nope, k_pe.unsqueeze(1).expand(-1, N, -1)], dim=-1),
    81	    v
    82	)
    83	return spda_o @ W_O
    84	
    85	NOTE: in the actual code,
    86	    `kv_b_proj` is [W_UK; W_UV] concatnated per head
    87	    `q_b_proj` is [W_UQ; W_QR] concatnated per head
    88	    `out_proj` is W_O
    89	
    90	
    91	## Data-Movement Friendly Approach (i.e. "_forward_decode"):
    92	
    93	Ahead of time, compute:
    94	
    95	% this projects from q_c to [Sq, N * Lkv]
    96	W_UQ_UK = einsum("qnp,knp -> qnk"
    97	                     W_UQ.view(Lq, N, P), W_UK.view(Lkv, N, P)
    98	                ).view(Lkv, N * Lkv)
    99	% this projects from attn output [Sq, N * Lkv] to [Sq, H]
   100	W_UV_O  = einsum("knv,nvh -> nkh"
   101	                     W_UV.view(Lkv, N, V), W_O.view(N, V, H)
   102	                ).view(N * Lkv, H)
   103	
   104	Runtime
   105	q_c      = h_t @ W_DQ
   106	q_latent = q_c @ W_UQ_UK.view(Sq, N, Lkv)
   107	q_pe     = RoPE(q_c @ W_QR).view(Sq, N, R)
   108	new_kv_c = h_t @ W_DKV
   109	new_k_pe = RoPE(h_t @ W_KR)
   110	kv_c     = torch.cat([new_kv_c, cache_kv_c], dim=0)
   111	k_pe     = torch.cat([new_k_pe, cache_k_pe], dim=0)
   112	
   113	// MQA with QK headdim = Lkv + R
   114	//           V headdim = Lkv
   115	//      spda_o shape [Sq, N, Lkv]
   116	// NOTE: this is less compute-friendly since Lkv > P
   117	//       but is more data-movement friendly since its MQA vs MHA
   118	spda_o = scaled_dot_product_attention(
   119	    torch.cat([q_latent, q_pe], dim=-1),
   120	    torch.cat([kv_c, k_pe], dim=-1),
   121	    kv_c
   122	)
   123	return spda_o.reshape(-1, N * Lkv) @ W_UV_O
   124	
   125	
   126	## Chunked Prefill
   127	
   128	For chunked prefill we want to use the compute friendly algorithm. We are
   129	assuming sufficiently large Sq / Skv ratio, in the future may want to switch to
   130	the data-movement friendly approach if the chunk (i.e. `Sq`) is small.
   131	
   132	However, the compute-friendly approach can potentially run out of memory if Skv
   133	is large due to: `k_nope = (kv_c @ W_UK).view(Skv, N, P)`
   134	
   135	To mitigate this, we chunk the computation of attention with respect to the
   136	current context (i.e. `cache_kv_c` and `cache_k_pe`) so that we can used a
   137	fixed workspace size.
   138	
   139	The chunked prefill approach is as follows:
   140	
   141	MCC        Max chunk of context to process per iter, computed dynamically,
   142	           used to bound the memory usage
   143	
   144	q_c        = h_t @ W_DQ
   145	q_nope     = (q_c @ W_UQ).view(Sq, N, P)
   146	q_pe       = RoPE(q_c @ W_QR).view(Sq, N, R)
   147	new_kv_c   = h_t @ W_DKV
   148	new_k_pe   = RoPE(h_t @ W_KR)
   149	new_k_nope = (new_kv_c @ W_UK).view(Sq, N, P)
   150	new_v      = (new_kv_c @ W_UV).view(Sq, N, V)
   151	
   152	// MHA between queries and new KV
   153	//     with QK headdim = P + R
   154	//           V headdim = V
   155	//    curr_o   shape [Sq, N, V]
   156	//    curr_lse shape [N, Sq], this is just order FA returns
   157	curr_o, curr_lse = scaled_dot_product_attention(
   158	    torch.cat([q_nope, q_pe], dim=-1),
   159	    torch.cat([new_k_nope, new_k_pe.unsqueeze(1).expand(-1, N, -1)], dim=-1),
   160	    new_v,
   161	    casual=True,
   162	    return_softmax_lse=True
   163	)
   164	
   165	// Compute attention with the already existing context
   166	for chunk_idx in range(cdiv(C, MCC)):
   167	    chunk_start  = chunk_idx * MCC
   168	    chunk_end    = min(chunk_start + MCC, C)
   169	    Sc           = chunk_end - chunk_start
   170	    cache_kv_c_chunk   = cache_kv_c[chunk_start:chunk_end]
   171	    cache_k_pe_chunk   = cache_k_pe[chunk_start:chunk_end]
   172	    cache_k_nope_chunk = (cache_kv_c_chunk @ W_UK).view(-1, N, P)
   173	    cache_v_chunk      = (cache_kv_c_chunk @ W_UV).view(-1, N, V)
   174	
   175	    chunk_o, chunk_lse = scaled_dot_product_attention(
   176	        torch.cat([q_nope, q_pe], dim=-1),
   177	        torch.cat([cache_k_nope_chunk,
   178	                   cache_k_pe_chunk.unsqueeze(1).expand(-1, N, -1)],
   179	                   dim=-1),
   180	        cache_v_chunk,
   181	        casual=False,
   182	        return_softmax_lse=True
   183	    )
   184	
   185	    curr_o, curr_lse = merge_attn_states(
   186	        suffix_output=curr_o,
   187	        suffix_lse=curr_lse,
   188	        prefix_output=chunk_o,
   189	        prefix_lse=chunk_lse,
   190	    )
   191	
   192	return curr_o @ W_O
   193	"""

   625	        self.qk_head_dim = qk_head_dim
   626	        self.v_head_dim = v_head_dim

   706	                # CompressedTensorsW8A8Fp8 the input is dynamic per-token
   707	                # we ignore if it is static-per-tensor since we are going to
   708	                # requantize after later anyways
   709	                strategy = layer.scheme.strategy

   712	                elif strategy == QuantizationStrategy.CHANNEL:

   717	                        "fp8 MLA, please run with VLLM_MLA_DISABLE=1")

     4	
     5	First we define:
     6	
     7	Sq      as Q sequence length
     8	Skv     as KV sequence length
     9	
    10	MLA has two possible ways of computing, a data-movement friendly approach and a
    11	compute friendly approach, we generally want to use the compute friendly
    12	approach for "prefill" (i.e. the ratio Sq / Skv is "small", is near 1)
    13	and the data-movement friendly approach for "decode" (i.e. the ratio
    14	Sq / Skv is "large").
    15	
    16	NOTE what we deem small and large is currently determined by if its labelled
    17	prefill or decode by the scheduler, but this is something we should probably
    18	tune.
    19	
    20	Main reference: DeepseekV2 paper, and FlashInfer Implementation
    21	(https://arxiv.org/abs/2405.04434 and https://github.com/flashinfer-ai/flashinfer/pull/551).
    22	
    23	Deepseek's MLA attention works the following way:
    24	* Use a single latent vector to represent the per-token entry of the KV cache.
    25	* For decode (i.e. the memory friendly approach) the attention "simulates" a
    26	multi-head attention, while the compute is similar to multi-query attention.
    27	
    28	Below is example of both paths assuming batchsize = 1
    29	
    30	## More Extent Definitions:
    31	
    32	C           Context length, `Skv - Sq`
    33	H           hidden size
    34	N           number of attention heads
    35	Lq          latent dimension for Q              1536 in DSV3
    36	Lkv         latent dimension for K/V            512 in DSV3
    37	P           nope dimension, no rope.            128 in DSV3
    38	R           rope dimension, goes through rope.  64 in DSV3
    39	V           V head dim.                         128 in DSV3
    40	
    41	## Vector/Matrix Definitions
    42	
    43	h_t         hidden states (input to attention)  shape [Sq, H]
    44	q_c         latent/compressed Q                 shape [Sq, Lq]
    45	q_nope      uncompressed Q (no-rope)            shape [Sq, N, P]
    46	q_pe        uncompressed Q (rope)               shape [Sq, N, R]
    47	kv_c        latent/compressed KV                shape [Skv, Lkv]
    48	k_pe        decoupled k position embeddings     shape [Skv, R]
    49	new_kv_c    new kv_c from current iter          shape [Sq, Lkv]
    50	new_k_pe    new k_pe from current iter          shape [Sq, R]
    51	cache_kv_c  cached k_c from previous iters      shape [C, Lkv]
    52	cache_k_pe  cached k_pe from previous iters     shape [C, R]
    53	W_DQ        project h_t to q_c                  shape [H, Lq]
    54	W_UQ        project q_c to q_nope               shape [Lq, N * P]
    55	W_QR        project q_c to q_pe                 shape [Lq, N * R]
    56	W_DKV       project h_t to kv_c                 shape [H, Lkv]
    57	W_UK        project kv_c to k_nope              shape [Lkv, N * P]
    58	W_KR        project h_t to k_pe                 shape [H, N * R]
    59	W_UV        project kv_c to v                   shape [Lkv, N * V]
    60	W_O         project v to h_t                    shape [N * V, H]
    61	
    62	
    63	## Compute Friendly Approach (i.e. "_forward_prefill"):
    64	
    65	q_c      = h_t @ W_DQ
    66	q_nope   = (q_c @ W_UQ).view(Sq, N, P)
    67	q_pe     = RoPE(q_c @ W_QR).view(Sq, N, R)
    68	new_kv_c = h_t @ W_DKV
    69	new_k_pe = RoPE(h_t @ W_KR)
    70	kv_c     = torch.cat([new_kv_c, cache_kv_c], dim=0)
    71	k_pe     = torch.cat([new_k_pe, cache_k_pe], dim=0)
    72	k_nope   = (kv_c @ W_UK).view(Skv, N, P)
    73	v        = (kv_c @ W_UV).view(Skv, N, V)
    74	
    75	// MHA with QK headdim = P + R
    76	//           V headdim = V
    77	//      spda_o shape [Sq, N, V]
    78	spda_o = scaled_dot_product_attention(
    79	    torch.cat([q_nope, q_pe], dim=-1),
    80	    torch.cat([k_nope, k_pe.unsqueeze(1).expand(-1, N, -1)], dim=-1),
    81	    v
    82	)
    83	return spda_o @ W_O
    84	
    85	NOTE: in the actual code,
    86	    `kv_b_proj` is [W_UK; W_UV] concatnated per head
    87	    `q_b_proj` is [W_UQ; W_QR] concatnated per head
    88	    `out_proj` is W_O
    89	
    90	
    91	## Data-Movement Friendly Approach (i.e. "_forward_decode"):
    92	
    93	Ahead of time, compute:
    94	
    95	% this projects from q_c to [Sq, N * Lkv]
    96	W_UQ_UK = einsum("qnp,knp -> qnk"
    97	                     W_UQ.view(Lq, N, P), W_UK.view(Lkv, N, P)
    98	                ).view(Lkv, N * Lkv)
    99	% this projects from attn output [Sq, N * Lkv] to [Sq, H]
   100	W_UV_O  = einsum("knv,nvh -> nkh"
   101	                     W_UV.view(Lkv, N, V), W_O.view(N, V, H)
   102	                ).view(N * Lkv, H)
   103	
   104	Runtime
   105	q_c      = h_t @ W_DQ
   106	q_latent = q_c @ W_UQ_UK.view(Sq, N, Lkv)
   107	q_pe     = RoPE(q_c @ W_QR).view(Sq, N, R)
   108	new_kv_c = h_t @ W_DKV
   109	new_k_pe = RoPE(h_t @ W_KR)
   110	kv_c     = torch.cat([new_kv_c, cache_kv_c], dim=0)
   111	k_pe     = torch.cat([new_k_pe, cache_k_pe], dim=0)
   112	
   113	// MQA with QK headdim = Lkv + R
   114	//           V headdim = Lkv
   115	//      spda_o shape [Sq, N, Lkv]
   116	// NOTE: this is less compute-friendly since Lkv > P
   117	//       but is more data-movement friendly since its MQA vs MHA
   118	spda_o = scaled_dot_product_attention(
   119	    torch.cat([q_latent, q_pe], dim=-1),
   120	    torch.cat([kv_c, k_pe], dim=-1),
   121	    kv_c
   122	)
   123	return spda_o.reshape(-1, N * Lkv) @ W_UV_O
   124	
   125	
   126	## Chunked Prefill
   127	
   128	For chunked prefill we want to use the compute friendly algorithm. We are
   129	assuming sufficiently large Sq / Skv ratio, in the future may want to switch to
   130	the data-movement friendly approach if the chunk (i.e. `Sq`) is small.
   131	
   132	However, the compute-friendly approach can potentially run out of memory if Skv
   133	is large due to: `k_nope = (kv_c @ W_UK).view(Skv, N, P)`
   134	
   135	To mitigate this, we chunk the computation of attention with respect to the
   136	current context (i.e. `cache_kv_c` and `cache_k_pe`) so that we can used a
   137	fixed workspace size.
   138	
   139	The chunked prefill approach is as follows:
   140	
   141	MCC        Max chunk of context to process per iter, computed dynamically,
   142	           used to bound the memory usage
   143	
   144	q_c        = h_t @ W_DQ
   145	q_nope     = (q_c @ W_UQ).view(Sq, N, P)
   146	q_pe       = RoPE(q_c @ W_QR).view(Sq, N, R)
   147	new_kv_c   = h_t @ W_DKV
   148	new_k_pe   = RoPE(h_t @ W_KR)
   149	new_k_nope = (new_kv_c @ W_UK).view(Sq, N, P)
   150	new_v      = (new_kv_c @ W_UV).view(Sq, N, V)
   151	
   152	// MHA between queries and new KV
   153	//     with QK headdim = P + R
   154	//           V headdim = V
   155	//    curr_o   shape [Sq, N, V]
   156	//    curr_lse shape [N, Sq], this is just order FA returns
   157	curr_o, curr_lse = scaled_dot_product_attention(
   158	    torch.cat([q_nope, q_pe], dim=-1),
   159	    torch.cat([new_k_nope, new_k_pe.unsqueeze(1).expand(-1, N, -1)], dim=-1),
   160	    new_v,
   161	    casual=True,
   162	    return_softmax_lse=True
   163	)
   164	
   165	// Compute attention with the already existing context
   166	for chunk_idx in range(cdiv(C, MCC)):
   167	    chunk_start  = chunk_idx * MCC
   168	    chunk_end    = min(chunk_start + MCC, C)
   169	    Sc           = chunk_end - chunk_start
   170	    cache_kv_c_chunk   = cache_kv_c[chunk_start:chunk_end]
   171	    cache_k_pe_chunk   = cache_k_pe[chunk_start:chunk_end]
   172	    cache_k_nope_chunk = (cache_kv_c_chunk @ W_UK).view(-1, N, P)
   173	    cache_v_chunk      = (cache_kv_c_chunk @ W_UV).view(-1, N, V)
   174	
   175	    chunk_o, chunk_lse = scaled_dot_product_attention(
   176	        torch.cat([q_nope, q_pe], dim=-1),
   177	        torch.cat([cache_k_nope_chunk,
   178	                   cache_k_pe_chunk.unsqueeze(1).expand(-1, N, -1)],
   179	                   dim=-1),
   180	        cache_v_chunk,
   181	        casual=False,
   182	        return_softmax_lse=True
   183	    )
   184	
   185	    curr_o, curr_lse = merge_attn_states(
   186	        suffix_output=curr_o,
   187	        suffix_lse=curr_lse,
   188	        prefix_output=chunk_o,
   189	        prefix_lse=chunk_lse,
   190	    )
   191	
   192	return curr_o @ W_O
   193	"""
   194	
   195	import functools
   196	from abc import abstractmethod
   197	from dataclasses import dataclass
   198	from typing import TYPE_CHECKING, Any, Generic, Optional, TypeVar
   199	
   200	import torch
   201	from compressed_tensors.quantization import QuantizationStrategy
   202	
   203	from vllm import _custom_ops as ops
   204	from vllm import envs
   205	from vllm.attention.backends.abstract import (AttentionBackend, AttentionLayer,
   206	                                              AttentionMetadata,
   207	                                              MLAAttentionImpl)
   208	from vllm.attention.backends.utils import get_flash_attn_version
   209	from vllm.attention.ops.triton_merge_attn_states import merge_attn_states
   210	from vllm.distributed import (get_tensor_model_parallel_world_size,
   211	                              tensor_model_parallel_all_reduce)
   212	from vllm.logger import init_logger
   213	from vllm.model_executor.layers.linear import (ColumnParallelLinear,
   214	                                               LinearBase, RowParallelLinear,
   215	                                               UnquantizedLinearMethod)
   216	from vllm.model_executor.layers.quantization.compressed_tensors.compressed_tensors import (  # noqa: E501
   217	    CompressedTensorsLinearMethod)
   218	from vllm.model_executor.layers.quantization.compressed_tensors.schemes import (
   219	    CompressedTensorsW8A8Fp8)

   414	            num_tokens = scheduler_output.num_scheduled_tokens[req_id]
   415	            # for now treat 1 scheduled token as "decode" even if its not,
   416	            # we should update this to something like < 8 in the future but
